intro: Lomatogonium brachyantherum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lomatogonium, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
